title: [Self-Directed] Educational Integration of Immersive Web Environments (IWE): Bloom’s Taxonomy-Based Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational technology skills and experience with digital devices
context.additional_context: Focused on developing IWE (Integrated Web-based Environment) strategies specialized for social studies, targeting pre-service/in-service teachers. Considers smartphone accessibility and limited-technology conditions

learning_goals: Learners can propose three or more lesson plans aligned with Bloom’s Taxonomy (6 levels: Remember-Understand-Apply-Analyze-Evaluate-Create) using IWE.
Learners can create two or more activity materials utilizing IWE tools (e.g., 360-degree virtual field trips, augmented reality quizzes) in social studies contexts.
Learners can propose three practical solutions for issues (accessibility, interaction limitations, etc.) arising when applying IWE in limited technological environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
